data.text:
"Efforts to tackle #COVID19 & begin the recovery process will only be successful if everyone's rights to life & health are protected, without discrimination."

-- @UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet on the impact of #coronavirus on racial & ethnic minorities. https://t.co/qnD85EG6yd https://t.co/uj5nTu9eoR

Children need peace and protection.

On Thursday's International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression, see how the @UNICEF works for safety & protection #ForEveryChild: https://t.co/v7g5gzdjKP https://t.co/bsn9KeXrZX

Meet Dr. Heval Kelli – a former refugee, dishwasher, now on the frontline of #COVID19 response.

“You're living proof of the power of inclusion - and how refugees & migrants can be part of the solution," said @antonioguterres in a video call. 

https://t.co/y6Mh3SPZtd

"#COVID19 continues to devastate lives and livelihoods around the globe — hitting the most vulnerable the hardest."

@antonioguterres highlights need to protect refugees & migrants amid the #coronavirus crisis and recover better for the benefit of all. https://t.co/dpybH1Vmfl https://t.co/FWrpx0a6ss

Through its network of global humanitarian hubs, @WFP is dispatching humanitarian & medical cargo to 120+ countries -- providing a vital lifeline to some of the world's most vulnerable people during the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/YnoFK1y5Ye 

https://t.co/D23m1n1mD2

Misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable.
❌ Don't share rumors
✔️ Choose content verified by reliable sources

🎨: Ruth Burrows https://t.co/clySlUrQhA

"We all have a responsibility to #FightRacism. #COVID19 or not, I call on everyone to to take a stand, speak up and put an end to racism wherever present."

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet.

Here's what you can do to #StandUp4HumanRights: https://t.co/QfR5x0N4Zb https://t.co/eqwEoMDDbG

Women are facing unique challenges during the #COVID19 pandemic.

@UN_Women tests your knowledge of how the crisis has affected women on the frontlines of the response, as well as at home. https://t.co/h9a6ZtV78i

On Wednesday's World Bicycle Day, see how the UN is supporting efforts to use bicycles to transform mobility during the #COVID19 pandemic, while also helping to create a greener, more sustainable post-crisis future.

https://t.co/Bn8OxwIVNn

All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights. 

We can all stand up against racism, discrimination & intolerance. 

#StandUp4HumanRights today & every day. https://t.co/Fx0uQPmvW7 https://t.co/6ecphFG4qQ

Yemen is the largest humanitarian crisis in the world, with 80% of the population in need of humanitarian assistance. 

As donors pledged $1.35 billion dollars on Tuesday's virtual conference for Yemen, see how @UNICEF is helping children there. 

https://t.co/8C2FjKs0sq

𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 racism
𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 discrimination
𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 intolerance
𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 violence
𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 hate

We must work together to #StandUp4HumanRights and 𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 all forms of racism & discrimination. https://t.co/QfR5x14GnL https://t.co/n67aHCctUf

Biodiversity is critical for human development & well-being.

Ahead of #WorldEnvironmentDay, learn about the link between taking action #ForNature & achieving the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/0MBj3Pm1Sy

https://t.co/0koLoECOGk

During the #COVID19 crisis, the UN has continued its lifesaving work in support of people & communities around the world.

Check out the latest in this @Twitter moment.
https://t.co/J6HJRYuA1V

Amid #COVID19, refugee tailors are answering the call for more personal protective equipment.

Meet some of the talented artisans who are stepping up to help, sewing fabric masks & more for those in need. https://t.co/euBM6KoaDZ https://t.co/I08AbqboiK

With many schools closed due to #COVID19, the UN is supporting parents as they teach their children about some of the most important issues facing humanity, including the #GlobalGoals and #ClimateAction. 

https://t.co/C959ZR9874

"We must raise our voices against all expressions of racism and instances of racist behaviour." 
-@antonioguterres.

Racism & intolerance are problems prevalent in all societies. But each of us can stand up against racial prejudice & intolerant attitudes. https://t.co/QfR5x14GnL https://t.co/UuL2pLGsH7

#LGBTI rights = HUMAN rights

This #PrideMonth, join UN @free_equal in the fight against transphobia & homophobia. https://t.co/9opL2WMnjN https://t.co/dtJCDzfped

Want to tell a friend or family member that something they shared about #COVID19 might not be true?

Check out this video to find out how. Share it with your friends & family to help stop the spread of harmful misinformation.

Get more verified info: https://t.co/LV9n3DX6QM https://t.co/bZb4Q2iyzT

On Global Day of Parents, here's a reminder to all parents to take time for yourself when you can. This important advice is based on guidance from @WHO. https://t.co/bu2OnHBU4J https://t.co/CEU5l8LhZJ

During these stressful times, we are stronger together: 

📲 Video call a loved one
💙 Be kind to someone in need
🎨 Learn a new skill
📰 Take a break from the news
🚴‍♀️ Exercise
📓 Journal

via @UN_Women https://t.co/4mZwRVcd1e #COVID19 https://t.co/AtDnficjPM

What should you do if you see misinformation on #COVID19 being shared in your social networks?

Have empathy - and avoid just saying "You're wrong."

More useful advice here from @firstdraftnews' Claire Wardle. https://t.co/pgm1ht5Ri0
France assumes the presidency of the Security Council for the month of June. Follow @franceonu for updates: https://t.co/NNsOYifeCC https://t.co/GubC1urdrB

Monday is Global Day of Parents. 

As families bear the brunt of the #COVID19 pandemic, more family-friendly workplace practices & stronger childcare policies are needed more than ever. 

https://t.co/klRzCVT0I5 https://t.co/WoQIkTYQlp

Lung health is not for sale. 

Tobacco companies spent an average of $23 million on marketing every day. 

On Sunday’s World #NoTobacco Day, learn more about how to avoid tobacco industry manipulation. https://t.co/917t8JjIHB #TobaccoExposed https://t.co/a5VMogCk8T

#VaccinesWork

Vaccines are safe & help prevent millions of deaths every year. Yet, a growing number of networks seek to undermine trust in vaccinations. 

Share this @WHO guidance & help spread information that saves lives.  

More verified information: https://t.co/LV9n3DFvZe https://t.co/uM9PTvNQpo

Children & adolescents who use e-cigarettes at least double their chance of smoking cigarettes later in life & are at risk of heart disease & lung disorders.

On Sunday’s World #NoTobacco Day, show support for a tobacco-free generation. https://t.co/917t8JjIHB #TobaccoExposed https://t.co/iNPn5x29J8

.@UNVolunteers are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 pandemic.

From distributing food to providing medical care, see how volunteers are helping to protect communities in Africa during the #coronavirus crisis. via @UNDP

https://t.co/OjgKZUhIt7

Tobacco products are not essential during the #COVID19 pandemic - or ever. 

Sunday is World #NoTobacco Day. 

Help create a generation that is free from tobacco and the death & disease that it causes. https://t.co/917t8JjIHB #TobaccoExposed https://t.co/RtCUBEJ875

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against #coronavirus.

🎨:  Nat Bullard https://t.co/tAK4nskUuK

Tobacco products kill over 8M people yearly - & for decades, the tobacco industry has employed tactics to attract young people to their products. 

On Sunday’s World #NoTobacco Day, show your support for achieving a tobacco-free generation. https://t.co/917t8J27j1 #TobaccoExposed https://t.co/xGVF0FATQk

The #COVID19 pandemic has left 60% of world’s children missing education. 

New @UNDP data shows universal internet access could help children get back to learning and reduce generational inequalities. https://t.co/for5QBTaTm https://t.co/zFV5rXVnJH

Now more than ever, we need global solidarity to defeat #COVID19.

See how people are helping each other & showing goodwill during the #coronavirus crisis in this new @Twitter moment. https://t.co/ukacGqocn4

As #MentalHealthMonth comes to an end, here are some tips to help you cope with these stressful times:

💛Share some love
🤳Check in with family & friends
📰Take a break from news
⏲️Make time to unwind

Remember, you are not alone. https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 #COVID19 via @UN_Women https://t.co/ClcHSAcY7B

𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 racism 

𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 anti-semitism 

𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 xenophobia 

𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 intolerance 

We can all #StandUp4HumanRights and help build a world free of discrimination, hate & violence. https://t.co/zbfIgt1ke7

Hate speech, stigma, discrimination & xenophobia are all on rise as a result of #COVID19.

Here's how the UN is working to #StandUp4HumanRights & promote solidarity during the pandemic.

https://t.co/Gx6EK75sAT

Young people, and particularly young women, are disproportionately affected by the #COVID19 pandemic. 

New @ILO report shows that more than 1 in 6 young people are out of work due to the crisis. 
https://t.co/p44sKv7VRJ

The #COVID19 pandemic & the social and economic crisis it triggered threaten the advancement of #GlobalGoals.

World leaders came together on Thursday to share concrete solutions to the development emergency caused by #coronavirus.
https://t.co/ngGgjEKmQB https://t.co/MZhAz6FmSL

"More than 3,900 women & men have lost their lives serving with @UNPeacekeeping since 1948. On UN Peacekeepers Day, and every day, we honour their service, sacrifice & selflessness."

-- @antonioguterres on #PKDay. https://t.co/IHPy950Ab4 https://t.co/RnusnPjuMb

#COVID19 threatens us all, whoever we are, wherever we live.

Now more than ever, the world needs @WHO. https://t.co/jLiwlbcF2D

https://t.co/FPOFkjLCU0

Journalism is not a crime. 

A free press is essential for peace, justice & human rights for all.

See how @UNESCO supports press freedom. https://t.co/T9iHA9mfbt https://t.co/hoMgvyX2WP

#VaccinesWork

A growing number of networks seek to undermine trust in vaccinations. As we await a safe vaccine for #COVID19, everyone must have access to the basic facts on vaccines.

Share this @WHO guidance & help spread information that saves lives.  https://t.co/NILAmXVhH6 https://t.co/MzOqgLNbYl

"The role that entrenched and pervasive racial discrimination plays in such deaths must be fully examined, properly recognized and dealt with."

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet on death of #GeorgeFloyd in the USA. https://t.co/lMDj7G5ZXk https://t.co/1fICdYffHd

More women in peacekeeping = more perspectives & solutions in a crisis. 

From raising awareness to performing peace & security tasks, women are key to @UNPeacekeeping’s #COVID19 response. 
 
More on Friday's International Day of UN Peacekeepers: https://t.co/IHPy950Ab4 #PKDay https://t.co/sI14wWon9p

The world can only contain #COVID19 if every person has access to accurate, reliable information. 

That’s down to all of us. 

Sign up to Verified to receive content you can trust: life-saving info, fact-based advice & stories from the best of humanity: https://t.co/LV9n3DFvZe https://t.co/eHL0Gi9lTR

Friday is International Day of UN Peacekeepers. 

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, gender parity in peacekeeping is more important than ever.

Take a look at a @UNPeacekeeping virtual exhibit to salute women's contributions to peace & security. https://t.co/aoXSAW9qrj #PKDay https://t.co/T5DkXAOCmz

Nurses
doctors
sanitation workers
journalists
truck drivers
grocery store workers
researchers
& all essential workers

are risking their well-being to serve their communities.

We thank them for being on the front lines during the #COVID19 pandemic.

🎨: Mahalakshmi Guruprasad https://t.co/LnfYIdpTiI

#WomenInPeacekeeping:
✅ are role models
✅ help reduce conflict

On Friday's International Day of UN Peacekeepers, we salute the important role that women play in achieving lasting peace around the 🌎🕊️. 

https://t.co/IHPy950Ab4 #PKDay https://t.co/e5cu6KBXlB

#COVID19 is changing our world -- but with the right approach, we can build back better & stronger. 

Recycling, reusing, planting trees - there are many ways to take #ClimateAction & play a part in making the world a better place. https://t.co/ObsefnDqZK https://t.co/pGxjj0nKQ3

Friday is International Day of UN Peacekeepers. 

More women in @UNPeacekeeping means:
🔑 increased effectiveness
🔑 new perspectives and solutions
🔑 greater resources
🔑 stronger efforts towards peace process

More on this year's #PKDay: https://t.co/IHPy950Ab4 https://t.co/oEDf3thUR4

"#COVID19 is not just this century’s largest public health emergency, but also a communication crisis."

--UN global communications chief @MelissaFleming on the new 'Verified' initiative to bring people trusted information & life-saving advice. 

https://t.co/O1K8Xju2zD

Diversity is a strength, not a threat. 

Yet racism is a problem in every country. 

Speak out and #FightRacism & intolerance every day, everywhere. https://t.co/QpwavXjVnW https://t.co/dIMbragSqp

The world must unite to overcome #COVID19. 

See how world leaders came together to pledge their commitments to rebuilding societies & economies after the #coronavirus crisis in this new @Twitter moment.

https://t.co/Q0F5xiMV65

#COVID19 will likely leave millions more people food insecure. 

On Thursday's World Hunger Day, see how @WFP has expanded food security monitoring systems to help those most in need. https://t.co/6aSmvvjlqQ #ZeroHunger

 https://t.co/F6J5J1hhrB

Let's end the stigma around menstruation. Period. 

On Thursday's #MenstrualHygieneDay & every day, @UN_Women works to safeguard the health of women & girls without stress, shame, or unnecessary barriers to information or menstrual supplies.  https://t.co/wDyrYe6sF1 https://t.co/ZfDQn8RvpC

The #COVID19 crisis could put nearly 265 million people at risk of acute hunger by the end of 2020. 

On Thursday's World Hunger Day, see how UN humanitarian teams are scaling up efforts to reach millions of food insecure people. https://t.co/2JjmJHB3ZY #ZeroHunger https://t.co/Ln8pHP1mLw
World leaders will come together on Thursday to share financing solutions for the health & development challenges created by #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/ngGgjEsLs1 https://t.co/HJ8eBQ12oB

#Coronavirus fiction is often circulating faster than fact, endangering the public health response - and ultimately, people’s lives.

-UN global communications chief @MelissaFleming on new Verified initiative. 

https://t.co/gUexEvPUdL

Thursday is #MenstrualHygieneDay.

Nearly 1.25 billion women & girls don't have access to a safe, private toilet, which affects how they're able to manage their periods.

In some cases, these challenge are worsened by the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/wDyrYe6sF1 via @un_women https://t.co/TkcH5Zcwvq

"Where armed conflict continues, #COVID19 makes the protection of civilians more challenging than ever – and our support more important than ever."

-- @antonioguterres at Security Council meeting on the protection of civilians. https://t.co/BmFN0Md5pg https://t.co/NwO3KLE8hG

Misinformation is harmful. If we didn't share bad content we wouldn't have a problem.

— @firstdraftnews' Claire Wardle on how to stop yourself & others sharing misinformation around #COVID19.

Get more Verified information: https://t.co/WdwMDqm3c1 https://t.co/yXn4OYLOKh

72 years after @WHO was founded, the world is in the grips of the #coronavirus crisis. 

Now more than ever, the world needs @WHO, not only to defeat #COVID19 but to build a healthier, safer, fairer world for everyone. https://t.co/hr02jOGVj3 

https://t.co/JGrlB0xNMr

#COVID19 could cost the global economy up to $8.5 trillion over next 2 years, pushing 34 million people into extreme poverty.

Every effort must be taken to stabilize economies & support the most vulnerable. #GlobalGoals https://t.co/w0MkQ6VWHF https://t.co/kqGcNQnFOU

Civil society plays a key role in addressing the most critical challenges the world is facing today, including #COVID19.

NGOs are invited to apply for consultative status with @UNECOSOC through 1 June to help find solutions for a better world. https://t.co/cKdCJpPaJi via @UNDESA https://t.co/zjVqhWFxIZ

As the world grapples with #COVID19, there are still many unknowns about the short- and long-term impacts of the crisis.

New findings from @UNDP shed light on how the pandemic may impact future socio-economic development. https://t.co/vQqBNK0l36 https://t.co/PCm0MrM0p3

Refugees, asylum-seekers, stateless people & migrants must be able to access health services without facing discrimination.

Inclusive & non-discriminatory policies are needed to combat #COVID19. https://t.co/lQYNErKTnt via @Refugees https://t.co/qrHMpV4FvA

"Our deep feelings of powerlessness must lead to greater humility. Deadly global threats require a new unity and solidarity."

-- @antonioguterres on the need for global action to contain #COVID19. https://t.co/TapFs7zLbH #WHA73 https://t.co/Kbo9SUGWgo

Physical distancing does not have to mean social or emotional isolation. 

Connect with your loved ones. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together.

🎨: Nubefy Design for All https://t.co/GNZ00vyuo9

Investing in green transport post #COVID19 recovery could create up to 15 million new jobs worldwide, with greener & healthier economies & a more sustainable future for us all. 
https://t.co/2tUncewoMA #GlobalGoals

Want to know the correct way to wear a face mask? Here's the latest advice from @WHO.

Get more Verified information: https://t.co/fIsE7lpJv5 https://t.co/37SlUqkILv

From physical distancing at relief sites to @WhatsApp classrooms, see how #COVID19 is changing humanitarian operations worldwide. via @UNOCHA 

https://t.co/cyce8fPPGR

Vaccines are safe.

They help prevent millions of deaths every year & are continuously monitored to make sure they are safe & effective.

More facts about why #VaccinesWork from @WHO: https://t.co/NILAmXVhH6 https://t.co/dgjGKJZm3O

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against #coronavirus.

🎨: Human After All studio https://t.co/yWVYSADxhM

🏠 Staying home
🧼 👏 Handwashing
😇 Being kind to each other

Whatever you are doing to stop the spread of #COVID19 – keep it up! https://t.co/7utoMqxLWk

Seats on a @WFP_UNHAS flight would usually be full of humanitarian workers.

But amid the #COVID10 pandemic, the space is being used to get vital supplies to those most in need. 

More on this lifesaving work: https://t.co/IUvfCuUMle https://t.co/5kOJdpYyi2

People with disabilities are among the most vulnerable groups in a health crisis like #COVID19. 

Reducing inequalities will be critical for rebuilding our economies & societies. https://t.co/xhDC9tz2Ow #GlobalGoals https://t.co/lH076c8MT2

The financial crisis triggered by #COVID19 could result in higher debt risks for developing countries.

@UNDESA is calling for aggressive policies to avoid a widespread, protracted crisis. https://t.co/2UrwshpwJr https://t.co/p8JqzQE8O9
In Somalia, @UNMAS & partners are not only keep communities safe from explosives, they are also raising awareness to help stop the spread of #COVID19: https://t.co/YRRPJioFcr https://t.co/FwOLOALceY

On Monday's #AfricaDay, @UNESCO will use music to help fight the wave of misinformation on #COVID19. 

🎶 Tune in at 1PM UTC for a virtual concert to bring the continent together in solidarity against #coronavirus: https://t.co/kxKXWh6rK2 https://t.co/0GvIOQa68P

Over 150 multinational companies are calling on governments to align policies & #COVID19 recovery plans with the latest climate science - to build sustainable & inclusive future. 

More from @GlobalCompact: https://t.co/cWMLIu0JAJ https://t.co/fEzFAQGHey

For many #LGBTI people, #COVID19 can pose unique challenges, including risks to their well-being and safety, increased exposure to violence, and higher levels of anxiety & depression.

More from @UNDP. https://t.co/NcWph59K3z https://t.co/DNNYW01YWr

"Mental health services are an essential part of all government responses to #COVID19. They must be expanded and fully funded."

-- @antonioguterres on the need to urgently address the mental health dimension of the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/sF86LVVBLZ https://t.co/yi0TnZ59KW

#FoodSafety should always be a priority, including during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Separate raw meat & cooked food 🥩
Keep your hands clean 🧼
Cook meat thoroughly 🥪
Store food safely 🥬

More from @WFP. https://t.co/3EoYwBSfkf https://t.co/hYWRXSwDVS

Physical distancing does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.

Connect with your loved ones. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together.

🎨: Leyah Mirza https://t.co/5aoLd3FUFS

The world can only contain #COVID19 if every person has access to accurate, reliable information. That’s down to all of us. 

Verified is our new initiative to encourage everyone to check the advice we share. Sign up for information you can trust. https://t.co/LV9n3DX6QM https://t.co/FRjKzvT6k5

All around the 🌎, women with @UNPeacekeeping are stepping up to support the #COVID19 response.

Ahead of Peacekeepers Day, see how they are showing solidarity with some of the most vulnerable during the #coronavirus crisis.  https://t.co/7H9jIBxL0L #PKday https://t.co/UjJJaToL6I

#COVID19 and school closures do not need to mean an end to learning opportunities. 

Free activity books from @FAO have important lessons about healthy diets, #ClimateAction and much more: https://t.co/UD3e0gqm67 https://t.co/6EwWYhiGF8
